Tribute to Maradona

Diego Maradona

Maradona's biography

Diego Armando Maradona (Spanish:ˈdjeɣo maɾaˈðona;was an Argentine professional football player and manager. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players in the history of the sport, he was one of the two joint winners of the FIFA Player of the 20th Century award. Maradona was given the nickname "El Pibe de Oro" ("The Golden Boy"), a name that stuck with him throughout his career. He also had a troubled off-field life and was banned in both 1991 and 1994 for abusing drugs

Notable Facts About Diego

  • Career: Professional footballer.
  • DOB: 30 October 1960.
  • Place of birth: Lanús, Argentina.
  • Date of death: 25 November 2020 (aged 60)
  • Place of death: Dique Luján, Argentina
  • Best known by many as the first out of two lengends to ever score a goal called Hand of God.
  • Nickname: El Pibe de Oro
  • Height: 1.65m (5 ft 5 in)
  • He married and had two daughters before divorcing
  • Maradona donated a signed Argentina jersey to Pope Francis, and it is kept in one of the Vatican Museums.
Quotes
"To see the ball, to run after it, makes me the happiest man in the world"
